message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with text recognition from scene images and video frames, which is a common problem in computer vision. The approach proposed in the paper is based on color channel selection and uses Hidden Markov Model (HMM) and Pyramidal Histogram of Oriented Gradient features. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as multi-label Support Vector Machine (SVM) classifier, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with video frames, which suggests that it could belong to cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper involves natural language processing techniques such as Optical Character Recognition (OCR), which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language).
